array.Name: DSOC
array.Description: The Deep Space Optical Communication technology demonstration uses a near-infrared laser to transmit and receive high-bandwidth data.

array.Name: Gamma-Ray and Neutron Spectrometer
array.Description: This instrument helps determine the chemical elements that make up the asteroid's surface material.

array.Name: Hall-effect Thruster
array.Description: These thrusters use a electromagentic fields to expel charged atoms, or ions, of inert xenon gas that in turn create thrust.

array.Name: Multilayer Insulation
array.Description: This thermal material reduces heat loss by thermal radiation.

array.Name: Multispectral Imager
array.Description: A pair of identical cameras equipped with filters and telescopic lenses to photograph the surface of the asteroid in different wavelengths of light.

array.Name: Propellant
array.Description: The Psyche spacecraft uses a propellant called xenon (a neutral gas used in car headlights and plasma TVs).

array.Name: Solar Panel
array.Description: This object absorbs the sun's rays as a source of energy for generating electricity and heating. The solar arrays power everything on board, including the science instruments.

array.Name: Meteoroid Detector
array.Description: This sensor detects meteoroids before potential collision.

array.Name: Magnetometer
array.Description: This instrument measures the magnetic field around the asteroid to search for evidence of an ancient magnetic field.

array.Name: Battery
array.Description: A place to store the energy collected by your solar panels.

array.Name: Repair Kit
array.Description: This kit repairs the damage from one collision.
